newsitem.title: USA: Syncronys sees higher Q4 results.
newsitem.headline: Syncronys sees higher Q4 results.

text.p: Syncronys Softcorp said Wednesday it expects to report a fourth fiscal quarter profit of $800,000 to $1 million, or $0.04 to $0.05 per share, on revenues of $4 million.

This compares with a net loss of $10.2 million, or $0.74 per share, on no revenues in the year-ago quarter, and net income of $391,000, or $0.02 per share, on revenues of $3.2 million in the quarter ended March 31, 1997.
Syncronys said its balance sheet at the end of the fourth quarter, June 30, will reflect working capital of $6.5 million, $3.4 million of which is in cash and equivalents.

The company said the principal value of its 10 percent convertible debentures outstanding, issued in May 1996, stands at only $1.5 million. Depending on market conditions, it is continuing its redemption-upon-conversion program for these debentures, the company said. It expects to report audited fiscal year results next month when it files its annual 10K report.

Commenting on the quarter, Rainer Poertner, chief executive officer, said, "Syncronys continues to execute on its growth strategy of increasing its earnings power through a growing roster of strong products in full retail, catalog and Internet distribution, and a full pipeline of exciting new PC software technologies scheduled for introduction throughout the remainder of this year."
